The money must be used for the good of the family.

Q63: What proportion of everyday food can the family obtain without buying in the last 3 months?

N13: TABULAR DATA AHEAD
The following question will ask for details of food bought by the family pre-UCT and at present (now).
We would like to ask some questions about the quantity of food bought by your family in two periods: July 2014 and from July 2014 to the present.
At present, does your family buy (food item)? If Yes, how much quantity of (food item) does your family buy?
Before July 2014, did your family also buy (food item)? If Yes, how much quantity of (food item) did your family buy?
Compare the quantity that your bought at present with that before July 2014, Has your family's consumption of (food item): Decreased (DC), Did not change (NC), Increased (IC), Improved quality (IQ) or its a New item for the family (NEW)?

group.label: T11: Food bought by family pre-UCT and now

Q64.9: Consumption

input.label: Q65: Record any comments related. For example: "walang mabili", "hindi dapat paggamitan ng pera", "masyadong mahal", etc

N14: TABULAR DATA AHEAD
Last month in September, did you buy any of the following item?
Note to the interviewer: Read each item to the interviewee. If family bought the item, ask the questions below, for the same quantity and quality of product (e.g. 1 kilo of whole chicken, can of mungo beans, pack of noodles, 1 dozen medium eggs, etc. as applicable). If interviewee does not know the unit or quality, it does not matter as long as the quality or unit reference is the same last month and in June 2014.
What was the usual price of the item last month? What was the usual price of the item sometime in June 2014 for the same quantity and quality of item?

select1.label: Q65.1: Food expenditure category
Q65.2: Food item

input.label: Q65.3: Other (specify)
Q65.4: Usual price per unit of quantity last month (September)
Q65.5: Usual price per unit of quantity June 2014
Q65.6: If price is different, ask why

select1.label: Q66.1: Before Yolanda came, there were times when: you worried that food would run out before you got money to buy more food
Q66.2: Before Yolanda came, there were times when: food you bought actually did not last
Q66.3: Before Yolanda came, there were times when: the children were not eating enough because you could not afford to buy enough
Q67.1: Before the UCT, there were times when: you worried that food would run out before you receive more food aid or got money to buy more food
Q67.2: Before the UCT, there were times when: the food you bought or the food you received from relief actually did not last and you did not have enough money to get more
Q67.3: Before the UCT, there were times when: the children were not eating enough because you did not receive enough food and you could not afford to buy more
Q68.1: At present, there are times when: you worry that food would run out before you get money to buy more food
Q68.2: At present, there are times when: the food you buy actually do not last and you do not have enough money to get more
Q68.3: At present, there are times when: the children are not eating enough because you cannot afford to buy enough food

select1.label: Q97: Although the use of the money is your decision, you might have heard some advice regarding the use of money. If any, what are the advice?

item.label: The money must be used for the good of the family.
The money should be used to improve their house or obtain the items for the house that they need.
The money that they need should be used for family''s food and children's nutrition.
The money is for children's education and health.
The money should be used by the family for items related to livelihood.
The money should not be used for cigarettes, liquor, or gambling.

input.label: Q97.1: Other advice (specify advice)

select1.label: Q98: Of the specific advice mentioned above, which ones are you following?

item.label: The money must be used for the good of the family.
The money should be used to improve their house or obtain the items for the house that they need.
The money that they need should be used for family''s food and children's nutrition.
The money is for children's education and health.
